answers.answer: Yes it's a must. If you want to breastfeed best to get maternity bras. If you use bras that have wire sitting under your breasts your at risk of getting mastiti
Hmmm never heard of that.. Google  here we come lol thanks
I just wear a sports bra with no wire when i might bf
Nursing bras with strap snapdowns are incredibly convenient. Definitely worth buying them. Nursing tanks are awesome as well.
I didnt use a nursing bra with my last and with large breasts I did wear bras with underwire and was lucky enough to have no problems. At night I used a nursing bra for comfort.
NO it is not a must....I'm on my 3rd have breastfed both of my babies & have never had any issues
It makes breastfeeding a lot easier .! :)

Nope it's not a must. I bought 5 of them since they seems more convenient but my mom said I was crazy for spending the money and she didn't use them. She said all you need is some comfy sports bras and truthfully that's really all a nursing bra is. You could check out Hanes or nomorerack they usually have sales on sports bras if you need to get some.

Yes. It is very important for you as well as your newborn. Helps with reducing the chances of breast cancer, you loose 500 calories every time you breastfeed (depending the length of the feeding).It supplies all the necessary nutrients in the proper proportions.It protects against allergies, sickness, and obesity.It protects against diseases, like diabetes and cancer.It protects against infections, like ear infections.It is easily digested – no constipation, diarrhea or upset stomach.Babies have healthier weights as they grow. So it's best if you do, nature intended it

If you are on Facebook search for the dairy fairy.  It's a nursing bra company started by moms. Their bras are cute and functional.  The bras have built in flange holders, so when you need to pump you can do so hands free.
